definition[1]: someone who speaks officially for a company, organization, or group of people
example[0]: Safety reps have the right to stop the job when workers are in danger.
example[1]: You need to speak to the students’ rep.
definition[3]: repertory, or a repertory theatre or company
example[2]: Most actors start off in rep.
definition[5]: one exercise that you do in a series of exercises
definition[6]: the written abbreviation of Representative, used before names
definition[7]: someone employed to sell a company’s products or services by meeting customers or talking to them on the phone
example[5]: We needed more sales reps on the road to compete with the big boys.
definition[8]: someone who speaks officially for a group of people, company etc
example[6]: He’d had a chat with his union rep and was told not to worry.
